'We're buying time, but we won't win the fight': Senegal's Saint-Louis faces the inexorable rise of the sea
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (3/6). Senegal's historic city will be largely underwater by the end of the 21st century. Several thousand fishermen have already left their homes on the beach for a stifling dormitory town.

Northern Haiti is the country's showcase for tourists, but gang violence is crippling activity
subhead: The Cap-Haïtien region boasts many world-renowned historic sites. Yet foreign visitors have become scarce in what is known as the country's 'tourism capital,' as Haiti faces a deep political and security crisis.

headline: 'Pessimism has taken hold in a once-optimistic China'
subhead: China's economy is now showing difficulty advancing. Le Monde journalist Harold Thibault describes civil society as increasingly prone to doubt after the stop-and-go approach of Xi Jinping's authoritarian policies.

headline: 'The Smashing Machine' is a deeply tender film about one champion's vulnerabilities
subhead: Benny Safdie has made his solo directorial debut by empathetically recounting the story of an American wrestling champion overcome by doubt and addiction.

headline: How Airbnb made France its favorite destination, with more than one million listings
subhead: 'The Airbnb Ogre' (1/6). In 15 years, the platform has established itself in France, the leading tourist destination, thanks to effective lobbying and favorable tax conditions. It has even worsened the housing crisis. The company is now expanding its offerings to continue its growth.

Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

headline: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.

headline: Romania's new 'National Cathedral,' the largest in the Orthodox world, sparks controversy
subhead: After 15 years of construction, the People's Salvation Cathedral in Bucharest opened its doors to the public on Sunday. A source of pride for many Romanians, it has also drawn criticism for its cost, which was largely funded by public money.
